image.altText: A man in a blue  HAZMAT suit putting something in a paper bag.

props.synopsis: A 26-year-old has been taken into custody after police discovered the body of a man in his 70s at a home north of Brisbane this morning.

image.altText: A beautiful lake with clear blue water and lush green banks.

props.synopsis: A man dies after falling 20 metres from a wind tower in central Queensland.

props.synopsis: In a worst-case scenario for Elon Musk, could Australia ban his platform if he refuses to take down all videos of the Wakeley church stabbing?

image.altText: Rosie Batty

props.synopsis: Former Australian of the Year Rosie Batty has reiterated calls for stronger language in cases of violence against women.

image.altText: An alarmed woman wearing a bikini on a beach stands up as a dingo looks at her bottom.

props.synopsis: Snapper Rocks was axed from the championship tour when the pandemic hit but the world's best surfers will return from 2025.

image.altText: A woman in military uniform in front of desert landscape.

props.synopsis: Space is the frontier forÂ Major General Susan Coyle, the soon-to-be highest-ranking woman in Australia's military, whose future is bright as she oversees new areas of conflict.

title.children: Meet Australia's first female chief in a 'warfighting domain'

image.altText: A line of beached whales stretches up a beach with people in the shallow water.

image.altText: An older man wearing his decorated military uniform aboard a destroyer ship

props.synopsis: Brian Hopkins was one of the last people to escape after two Australian naval ships collided. Living with terminal cancer, he revisits his former life and considers his legacy.

title.children: This veteran was in the shower when his navy warship collided with an aircraft carrier. He considers his legacy

image.altText: Animated character Bluey next to a car.

props.synopsis: In the much-anticipated Bluey special The Sign, the titular character is allowed to seat in the front passenger seat in line with Queensland road rules, prompting increased search traffic on the subject and calls to child safety organisations.Â

title.children: Bluey prompts questions around road rules and safety of front passenger seat for children

image.altText: A man with a shaved head, wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The eSafety commissioner's bid for the worldwide removal of footage of the Wakeley church stabbing is "silly", Opposition Leader Peter Dutton has said.

title.children: eSafety push for global takedown of stabbing video 'silly', Peter Dutton says

image.altText: A 106-year-old man sits on a floral couch and looks at the camera. Photo albums are open on the coffee table in front.

props.synopsis: World War II veteran Colin Wagener joined the military with three friends in 1938. He returned to Australia in 1945 after serving in Borneo, but has never joined an Anzac Day march.Â Â

title.children: 'It's not my thing': 106-year-old war veteran opts out of Anzac Day marches

image.altText: Two police officers in tactical gear stand on a street with their backs to the camera

props.synopsis: New South Wales Police has confirmed that five people aged between 14 and 17 have been charged following counterterrorism raids in Sydney.

title.children: Five teenagers charged after counterterrorism raids in Sydney

image.altText: Two rusted metal stakes being held.

props.synopsis: Bike riders warn the steel stakes could cause "a lot of damage and grief" as police and national rangers investigate the discovery in Noosa.

title.children: Sharpened metal spikes hidden on popular Queensland mountain bike trail spark alarm

image.altText: Two women in coats

props.synopsis: After decades of forcing Chinese couples to limit themselves to just one child, Beijing has now reversed course and is urging people to have more babies. The trouble is, many young people aren't interested.

title.children: Xi is urging Chinese women to get pregnant for the good of the country. Here's why many are ignoring him

image.altText: Crowd of people walking

props.synopsis: Anzac Day is commemorated across Australia and New Zealand, from dawn services and marches to games of two-up, on the 109th anniversary of the Gallipoli landings.

title.children: Dawn services, parades and two-up: Australians commemorate Anzac Day across the nation and beyond

image.altText: The view through a plane window of people bogged on an outback road.

props.synopsis: Police say they are working out how to retrieve the travellers from the flood-stricken area between Kalgoorlie-Boulder and the remote community ofÂ Tjuntjuntjara. A group of seven was rescued last month after running into similar trouble.

title.children: Rescue plan in the works after eight travellers found stranded in outback WA

image.altText: A screenshot of a video of a man with a missing lower arm with arabic text over it.

props.synopsis: Rachel Goldberg and Jon Polin had assumed they would never see their son again â€” but that changed when Hamas released a hostage video featuring a one-armed Hersh.Â

title.children: Hamas releases hostage video of American-Israeli Hersh Goldberg-Polin, sparking protests in Jerusalem

image.altText: Collingwood's Jamie Elliott leaps high with arms outstretched to take a mark on the shoulders of an Essendon player.

title.children: Magpies Elliott lights up the MCG with stunning hanger as Anzac Day blockbuster in the balance

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and PNG Prime Minister James MarapeÂ  lay at wreath at an ANZAC service.Â

props.synopsis: The prime minister tells the crowd at an Anzac Day dawn service in Papua New Guinea that Australia "will never forget" the help the country's people provided to Australian soldiers during World War II.

title.children: 'We will never forget' people of PNG: Albanese speaks at dawn service at Isurava

image.altText: A middle-aged woman with no hair and wearing glasses stands beside a mannequin wearing a red dress from the film The Dressmaker.

props.synopsis: A recent ABC News feature about how to share news of cancer diagnoses prompted some of our readers to share their own experiences. These are their words.

title.children: Readers share how they dealt with their cancer diagnoses

image.altText: Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence Commissioner Micaela Cronin.

props.synopsis: There is a crisis in Australia and women don't feel safe.Â The Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence commissioner wants that to change.

title.children: Violence against women is in the spotlight again. But this time, is the conversation shifting?

image.altText: Two frames, one of a mushroom cloud, the other an old man with medals.

props.synopsis: Sam Darke said he and other servicemen were "shocked" when they bore witness to Britain's nuclear bomb test at South Australia's Emu Field, feeling treated like "guinea pigs" who wore no protection and were simply told to cover their eyes.

title.children: Australian servicemen like Sam were 'guinea pigs' for nuclear bomb test that caused 'untold damage'

image.altText: A pink background with a red laptop and yellow emoticon faces flying around the edges of the screen

props.synopsis: Algorithmic feeds should personalise our online experiences, but instead they are "deadening our tastes" and fostering a dull conformity.

title.children: The insidious nature of algorithmic feeds and how they're flattening our culture

image.altText: Soldiers sitting on and swimming in water around a military landing transport with islands in the background.

props.synopsis: Australian Defence Force personnel and federal police officers have participated in 62 global peacekeeping missions since 1947, which one vet saysÂ "can be very complex, very confronting, especially when you're unarmed".

title.children: From building Blackhawk landing pads to collecting intelligence, the work of peacekeepers can be downplayed

image.altText: Man in doorway

props.synopsis: A man who repeatedly raped a young girl after breaking into her home in an ordeal lasting hours is released into the community because he is unfit to plead to the charges against him.

title.children: Man who repeatedly raped young girl released into community as judge rules him unfit to plead to charges

image.altText: Rudy Giuliani speaks to the press, wearing glasses and a suit, hand raised to chest level

props.synopsis: An Arizona grand jury indicts the former president's chief of staff Mark Meadows, lawyer Rudy Giuliani and 16 others for their efforts to use so-called fake electors to try to overturn Mr Trump's loss to Joe Biden in the 2020 US presidential election.

title.children: Arizona indicts 18 in 'fake elector' case, including Trump lawyer Rudy Giuliani

image.altText: A posthumous portrait of Lieutenant Michael McCaughey

props.synopsis: In the last days of 1943 a brave young Australian soldier, whose family played an influential role developing Australia's irrigation industries, lost his life trying to save wounded comrades in the mountains of Papua New Guinea.Â

title.children: Eight decades after their death, two Australian soldiers are helping advance an unlikely industry

image.altText: A composite image of close ups of Danielle Wood and Jim Chalmers.

props.synopsis: While Anthony Albanese says we're in a "race for jobs" with other countries offering big government subsidies and can't afford to be "left behind", Productivity Commissioner Danielle Wood isn't sure it's a race we should even be in.

title.children: The government wants a future 'made in Australia'. The productivity commissioner isn't convinced

image.altText: Pedestrians cross Flinders Street near Swanston Street in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: The ABS has scrapped plans to collect information about ethnicity in the 2026 census, and some experts say it is missing a huge opportunity.Â

title.children: The ABS has changed its mind about ethnicity in the next census. Here's what the experts say

image.altText: A Solomon Islander in a red shirt dropping a vote in a box

props.synopsis: An intense period of political horse-trading is underway in Solomon Islands after no political party won enough seats in last week's election to form government on its own.

title.children: 'All sorts of corruption': Solomon Islands MPs head to hotels to pick the PM in 'extraordinary' process

image.altText: Vietnamese soldier in uniform of the left with John Bryant on teh right. They are standing in the jungle in front of trees.

props.synopsis: John Bryant has dedicated his life and life savings to uncovering the bodies of missing Vietnamese soldiers he and his battalion killed in combat.

title.children: Five decades after fighting in Vietnam, John Bryant has returned to help find the bodies he buried

image.altText: Four men from three generations of the Copeman family in photos.

props.synopsis: The Copeman family's commitment to the country spans generations from WWI to Vietnam. Now their legacy will live on in a memorial garden south-west of Sydney.

title.children: Three generations of sacrifice: The Copeman family's legacy of love and military service

image.altText: Daria Saville stretches to play a backhand while wearing a yellow top and green skirt. Fans hold Australian flags behind her.

props.synopsis: For the third time this year, there is only one Australian woman in the main draw of a WTA 1000 event, with Daria Saville beating qualifier Hailey Baptiste to reach the second round on the Madrid clay.

title.children: Lucky loser Saville wins through to second round as sole Australian in women's draw in Madrid
